label: Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS 557: Old English Fragments of the Legend of the Cross

metadata.label: Title
metadata.value: Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS 557: Old English Fragments of the Legend of the Cross

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: CCCC MS 557 consists of two fragments of eleventh-century Old English material removed from the bindings of two Parkerian printed books. Two further fragments from the same manuscript were removed from printed books in the collection of the Kenneth Spencer Research Library at the University of Kansas. The text is an Old English sermon on the True Cross. It has later annotations by the Tremulous Hand of Worcester, and was probably also written there

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Old English fragments of the Legend of the Cross

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Two Old English fragments of a single leaf on the legendary history of the Cross before Christ, from Worcester. Removed in 1952 from printed books donated to the College by Matthew Parker, SP.4, Tercia pars Chronici Carionis (Basle 1543) etc., and SP.260, Fides Iesu et Iesuitarum (Strasbourg, 1573).

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Mounted in melanex seemingly sealed. Bound in a folder. Details and references in N. R. Ker, Catalogue of Manuscripts containing Anglo-Saxon (1957), p. 122. Ker states that they are 'presumably part of a homily for the Invention of the Cross' like that in MS Bodley 343.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: This MS description is not part of the M. R. James catalogue; it is based in part on the description given in Vaughan and Fines, 'Handlist', p. 117.

metadata.label: Relation
metadata.value: UK, Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, Parker LibraryMS 557
